japanese: 運動量を増やすつもりなんだ。
english: I'm going to get more exercise.

japanese: もっと運動しなさい、さもないと太り過ぎになりますよ。
english: Do more exercise, or you'll get too fat.

japanese: もっと一生懸命勉強するように忠告してやってください。
english: Will you please advise him to work harder?

japanese: もっと一生懸命勉強しないと何事も成し遂げられません。
english: You'll never achieve anything if you don't study harder.

japanese: もっと勉強に身を入れないと何も成し遂げられないだろうよ。
english: You'll never achieve anything if you don't study harder.

japanese: もっと一生懸命勉強していたら君は試験に合格していただろうに。
english: If you had studied harder, you would have passed the examination.

japanese: もっと一生懸命勉強した方がよかったのに。
english: You had better have studied harder.

japanese: もっと安くなりますか。
english: Could you reduce the price a little?

japanese: もっと安い廉価版はないのですか。
english: Haven't you got a cheaper edition?

japanese: もっと安い本はないですか。
english: Haven't you got a cheaper edition?

japanese: もっと安いものはありますか。
english: Do you have anything cheaper?

japanese: もっと安いのはありませんか。
english: Do you have anything cheaper?

japanese: もっと安いのはありますか。
english: Do you have anything cheaper?

japanese: もっと安い席はありますか。
english: Do you have any cheaper seats?

japanese: もっと安い価格になりませんか。
english: Can you give me a better price?

japanese: もっと安いものを見せてください。
english: Show me a cheaper one, please.

japanese: もう少しお手頃な値段のものはありませんか？
english: Do you have anything less expensive?

japanese: もっとローストビーフを召し上がれ。
english: How about some more roast beef?

japanese: ローストビーフのおかわりはどうですか？
english: How about some more roast beef?

japanese: もっとよくわかるまで彼には内緒にしておこう。
english: Let's keep him in the dark until we know more.

japanese: もっとよい時代に生まれていたら、彼は有名になっていただろう。
english: Born in better times, he would have become famous.

japanese: もっとよい時代に生まれていたら、彼は大学者になっていただろう。
english: Born in better times, he would have become a great scholar.

japanese: もっとゆとりのある教育が必要だ。
english: The education system needs to be more flexible.

japanese: もっとゆっくり話せませんか。
english: Won't you speak more slowly?

japanese: もっとゆっくり話しなさいと彼は私に言いました。
english: He asked me to speak more slowly.

japanese: 彼は私に、もっとゆっくり話すように言った。
english: He asked me to speak more slowly.

japanese: もっとゆっくり歩くように先生に頼んだ。
english: We appealed to our teacher to go more slowly.

japanese: もっとゆっくり歩きなさい。
english: Walk more slowly.

japanese: もっとゆっくり走ってください。
english: Could you drive more slowly?

japanese: もっとゆっくり食べた方がいいよ。
english: You ought to eat more slowly.

japanese: もっとゆっくり運転しないと違反切符をもらうことになるよ。
english: Drive more slowly, or you'll get a ticket.

japanese: もっとゆっくりお願いできますか。
english: Could you speak more slowly, please?

japanese: もう少しゆっくり話していただけませんか。
english: Could you speak more slowly, please?

japanese: もっとも優秀な学生がクラスを代表して感謝の意をあらわした。
english: The brightest student expressed gratitude on behalf of his classmates.

japanese: もっとも美しい花がもっとも香りがよいとは限らない。
english: The handsomest flower is not sweetest.

japanese: もっとも速いランナーでも１００メートルを９秒では走れない。
english: The fastest runner can't run 100 meters in 9 seconds.

japanese: もっとも重要な点は、エメットの理論が物理学の従前の理論と矛盾しないということである。
english: It is that Emmet's theory is compatible with previous theories in physics that is of most significance.

japanese: もっとも重要なことは、脳にはこれらの解剖学的組織を結合する全体的な再入経路が必要である。
english: Most important of all, the brain needs global reentry pathways connecting these anatomical structures.

japanese: もっともやさしい問題から始めた方がいい。
english: You had better begin with easier questions.

japanese: もっとポテトチップスをご自由に召し上がれ。
english: Help yourself to more potato chips.

japanese: もっと早く来るべきだった。
english: I should have come earlier.

japanese: もっとパイが欲しい人はいますか。
english: Does anyone want some more pie?

japanese: パイがもっと欲しい人いる？
english: Does anyone want some more pie?

japanese: もっとのちにそのことを説明します。
english: I'll explain the matter to you later on.

japanese: もっとたくさん欲しい。
english: I want a lot more.

japanese: もっとしっかり仕事をしてよ。今回は物見遊山の旅じゃないんだから。
english: Buckle down and get to work. Do you think we're on a Sunday picnic here?

japanese: もっとクッキーをどうぞ。
english: Help yourself to more cookies.

japanese: もっとケーキをご自由に食べてください。
english: Please help yourself to some more cake.

japanese: もっとくだものをいかがですか、ゴロウ。
english: How about more fruit, Goro?

japanese: もっと果物を食べるべきです。
english: You should eat more fruit.

japanese: もっとクッキーはいかがですか。
english: Would you care for more cookies?

japanese: もっとお金を貯めたかったのだけれど。
english: I had hoped to save more money.

japanese: もっとお金を稼げたらいいなあと思います。
english: I wish I earned more money.

japanese: もっと稼げたらなぁ。
english: I wish I earned more money.

japanese: もっとお金をためようと思うんだ。
english: I'm going to save more money.

japanese: もっとお金があれば大きな家に移れるのにな。
english: If I had more money, I could move to a bigger house.

japanese: もっといい成績を得るように努力しなさい。
english: You should exert yourself to get better results.

japanese: もっとお金があれば、もっと大きな家に引っ越すでしょう。
english: We would move to a bigger house if we had more money.

japanese: モッツァレラ・チーズをかけたピザには、真っ先に飛びついてしまいます。
english: A pizza topped with mozzarella is my first choice.

japanese: もっといいこと思いつきませんか。
english: Can you think of something better?

japanese: もちろん利潤は生産費を上回るべきです。
english: Benefits of course should exceed the costs.

japanese: もちろん欲しければとってもいいよ。
english: Of course you can take it if you want.

japanese: もちろん、欲しければとってもいいですよ。
english: Of course you can take it if you want.

japanese: もちろん品も、そして郵送料すらも返ってこなかった。
english: Of course, neither goods nor mailing fee returned.

japanese: もちろん彼女はそれをやるだろう。
english: She'll do it as a matter of course.

japanese: もちろん彼女はその招待に応じた。
english: She naturally accepted the invitation.

japanese: もちろん彼を訪ねます。
english: I'll certainly go and see him.

japanese: もちろん彼は絶対に正しい。
english: As a matter of course, he is quite right.

japanese: もちろん彼の援助の申し出を受けたよ。
english: Of course I accepted his offer of support.

japanese: もちろん年輩者の中には、退職を喜ぶ人も多い。
english: Of course, many senior citizens are happy with retirement.

japanese: もちろん町でコンサートはありました。
english: Of course, there were concerts in the town.

japanese: もちろん地域独自の病院もあるべきだ。
english: Of course there should be local hospitals.

japanese: もちろん首相に面会するのは難しい。
english: Of course it's difficult to gain access to the Prime Minister.

japanese: もちろん磁石は周りに磁場を持っています。
english: The magnets, of course, have a magnetic field around them.

japanese: もちろん私も行きます。
english: Of course I will go.

japanese: もちろん、行くよ。
english: Of course I will go.

japanese: もちろん私はそのパーティーに行きます。
english: Of course, I will be at the party.

japanese: もちろん私たちの生活様式はアメリカのとは異なっている。
english: Of course our lifestyle is different from the one in America.

japanese: もちろん君は参加するものと思っていたよ。
english: I took it for granted that you would join.

japanese: もちろん空気は日光とともに、毎日の生活に欠かせぬものである。
english: Air as well as sunlight is, needless to say, indispensable to our daily life.

japanese: もちろん学生時代に英語は勉強したけど、本格的に始めたのはここ２、３年くらい前です。
english: Oh, sure, I studied English in my school days. But it wasn't until two or three years ago that I really started taking it seriously.

japanese: もちろんわれわれは最善を尽くさなければならない。
english: Of course, we must do our best.

japanese: もちろんのことだが、いなかの生活は都会の生活より健康によい。
english: It goes without saying that country life is healthier than town life.

japanese: もちろんですとも、どんどんやってください。
english: Sure, go right ahead.

japanese: もちろん、どうぞ。
english: Sure, go right ahead.

japanese: もちろんだよ！
english: Definitely!

japanese: もちろん！
english: Definitely!

japanese: もちろんそのニュースをたいへんよく覚えています。
english: Of course I remember the news quite well.

japanese: もちろんいいとも。
english: Of course, you may.

japanese: もちろん、いいよ。
english: Of course, you may.

japanese: なぜいけないの？
english: Why not?

japanese: どうしてダメなの？
english: Why not?

japanese: ぜひそうしよう。
english: Why not?

japanese: もちろん、両者はある点では似ている。
english: Of course they resemble each other in some ways.

japanese: もちろん、彼女は試験に合格した。
english: As a matter of course, she passed the examination.

japanese: もちろん、私は大変上手に車を運転できます。
english: Of course I can drive a car very well.

japanese: もちろん、じょうずに車を運転できます。
english: Of course I can drive a car very well.

japanese: もちろん、戦争には反対だ。
english: I am against the war, of course.

japanese: もちろん、私はまだ若いし、政治は大人がやっているんですもの。
english: Of course, I'm young, and politics is conducted by grown-ups.

japanese: もちろん、私はあなたとそこに行くつもりです。
english: Of course, I will go there with you.

japanese: もちろん、私です。
english: I am, of course.

japanese: もちろん、古いカーペットが価値があるためには、いい状態に保存されていなければならない。
english: Of course, to be valuable, an old carpet must be in good condition.

japanese: もちろん、喜んで。
english: Why not? I'd be happy to.

japanese: もちろん、ダーウィンは同時代の多くの学者と同様、ニュートンの方法論に従っていると見られることを欲した。
english: Of course Darwin, like many of his contemporaries, wished to be seen as following the Newtonian method.

japanese: もちろん、いいですよ。
english: By all means, go ahead.

japanese: もちろん、あなたを手伝ってあげますよ。
english: I will help you, of course.

japanese: 餅は餅屋。
english: Every man for his own trade.

japanese: モダンジャズは私の趣味に合わない。
english: Modern jazz is not to my taste.

japanese: モダンジャズは私の得意じゃない。
english: Modern jazz is not my line.

japanese: もうすぐ夜が明ける。
english: The day is breaking soon.

japanese: もうすぐ夜があけるよ。
english: The day is breaking soon.

japanese: モダンジャズに何を求めて聞けばいいのかわかると、私はそれを味わえるようになった。
english: Once I learned what to listen for, I came to appreciate modern jazz.

japanese: モスクワの冬は寒いから帽子をかぶったらいいよ。
english: It's best to wear a cap on your head during the cold Moscow winters.

japanese: モスクワに着くには、あと４日の行程です。
english: You've got another four day's journey before you reach Moscow.

japanese: もし論文の量が不足したら、引用文で水増ししておけばいい。
english: If your essay is on the short side, you can always pad it out with a few quotations.

japanese: もし留守中に誰かが来たら、私は夕方まで帰らないと言ってくれ。
english: If anyone comes in my absence, tell him that I won't come back till evening.

japanese: もし嵐でなかったら、会合に間に合っていただろうに。
english: If it had not been for the storm, we would have been in time for the meeting.

japanese: もし来れたら、私たちと一緒に来なさい。
english: If you can, come with us.

japanese: もし来られたら来なさい。
english: Come if possible.

japanese: もし来たければ、私たちと一緒にきなさい。
english: If you care to, come with us.

japanese: もし翼があれば、月まで飛んで行けるだろうか。
english: If we had wings, could we fly to the moon?

japanese: もし要求事をする場合、ここではちゃんと筋を通さないと決して出世はしない。
english: You'll never get ahead in this place unless you go through the proper channels.

japanese: もし予約があれば、いつでもチェックインできます。
english: Provided you have a reservation, you can check in anytime.

japanese: もし予防接種証明書があったらお持ちください。
english: If you have a certificate of immunization, please bring it when you come.

japanese: もし幽霊を見たら、どうしますか。
english: What would you do if you saw a ghost?

japanese: もし約束が守れない場合には、どう弁解しますか。
english: If you can't keep your promise, what excuse will you make?

japanese: もし面白い本を持っていましたら、少し貸してください。
english: If you have any interesting books, lend me some.

japanese: 明日天気なら外出します。
english: I will go out if it is fine tomorrow.

japanese: 明日天気なら出かけます。
english: I will go out if it is fine tomorrow.

japanese: もし明日天気が良かったら、私たちはピクニックに行くつもりです。
english: If it is sunny tomorrow, we will go on a picnic.

japanese: もしも明日晴れなら私たちはピクニックに行くでしょう。
english: If it is sunny tomorrow, we will go on a picnic.

japanese: もし明日雪がたくさん降れば、雪だるまを作ろう。
english: If it snows much tomorrow, let's make a snowman.

japanese: もし明日雪がたくさん降ったら、雪だるまを作ろう。
english: If it snows much tomorrow, let's make a snowman.

japanese: もし明日晴れなら、私たちは野球をします。
english: If it is fine tomorrow, we will play baseball.

japanese: もし明日晴れたら、私たちはピクニックに出かけます。
english: If it's a nice day tomorrow, we'll go on a picnic.

japanese: 明日雨なら、家にいます。
english: If it rains tomorrow, I'll stay at home.

japanese: もし明日雨ならば、私は家にいるつもりです。
english: If it rains tomorrow, I'll stay at home.

japanese: もし明日雨なら試合は中止です。
english: The game will be called off if it rains tomorrow.

japanese: もし明日雨ならば、私はその会合に行きません。
english: If it rains tomorrow, I'm not going to the meeting.

japanese: もし明日雨が降れば、野球の試合は延期されるだろう。
english: If it rains tomorrow, the baseball game will be put off.

japanese: もし明日雨が降れば、試合は延期されます。
english: If it is rainy tomorrow, the game will be put off.

japanese: 明日雨だったら、ピクニックに行かないよ。
english: If it rains tomorrow, I won't go on a picnic.

japanese: 明日雨が降れば、ピクニックには行かない。
english: If it rains tomorrow, I won't go on a picnic.

japanese: もし明日雨なら、ピクニックには行かないよ。
english: If it rains tomorrow, I won't go on a picnic.

japanese: 万一明日雨が降ったら、私たちはバスで行くよ。
english: If it should rain tomorrow, we would go by bus.

japanese: もし明日雨が降れば、私たちはバスで行くよ。
english: If it should rain tomorrow, we would go by bus.

japanese: 明日雨になったら、俺たちバスで行くよ。
english: If it should rain tomorrow, we would go by bus.

japanese: もし明日雨が降れば、家にいますか。
english: If it rains tomorrow, will you stay at home?

japanese: もし明日雨が降るなら車でそこへ行こう。
english: If it rains tomorrow, we will go there by car.

japanese: もし明日雨が降ったら、家にいましょう。
english: If it rains tomorrow, let's stay home.

japanese: 明日雨なら家にいようよ。
english: If it rains tomorrow, let's stay home.

japanese: もし無理な場合は注文をキャンセルします。
english: Otherwise we will have to cancel this order.

japanese: もし夢を実現させたいのなら、挑戦を続けなさい。
english: If you want to make your dreams come true, keep on trying.

japanese: もし眠るといけないので目覚し時計をセットしなさい。
english: In case you sleep, set the alarm.

japanese: もし万一明日雨が降れば、遠足は中止されるだろう。
english: If it should rain tomorrow, the excursion will be canceled.

japanese: もし万一彼に君を助ける気持ちがあれば、すぐにやってくるだろう。
english: If he would help you, he might come to you at once.

japanese: もし万一彼が遅れて来たらどうしよう。
english: What if he should happen to come late?

japanese: もし万一彼が遅れていたらどうしよう。
english: What if he should happen to be late?

japanese: もし万一彼が失敗すればどうなるのか。
english: What if he should fail?

japanese: もし万一彼が失敗したらどうなるだろうか。
english: What if he should fail?

japanese: もし万一手伝いが必要なら、ぜひお知らせください。
english: If you should need any help, just let me know.

japanese: もし万一再び失敗すると、私はその計画を断念するだろう。
english: If I should fail again, I would give up the plan.

japanese: もし万一外国へ行くとすれば、フランスにするでしょう。
english: If I happen to end up going abroad, I'd probably go for France.

japanese: もし万一何かおこったら、ぜひ知らせてください。
english: If anything should happen, please let me know.

japanese: もし万一ジョンから電話があったら、７時にもどると伝えて下さい。
english: If John should call me, tell him I'll be back at seven.

japanese: もし万一このよが明日終わるとしたら、どうしますか。
english: What would you do if the world were to come to an end tomorrow?

japanese: もし万が一彼女が日本に来るとすれば、ジェーンはとても喜ぶだろう。
english: If she should come to Japan, Jane would be very happy.

japanese: もし万が一私が失敗したら両親は何と言うだろう。
english: If I should fail, what would my parents say?

japanese: もし本当にお急ぎでなければ、ちょっと手助けしてもらえますか。
english: If you're sure you're not in a hurry, I can use a little help.

japanese: もし本がなければ、人生は退屈だろう。
english: If it were not for books, life would be boring.

japanese: もし僕の兄さんがここにいれば、どうすればいいかわかるだろう。
english: If my brother were here, he would know what to do.

japanese: もし僕が君ならそんなことは無視するだろう。
english: Were I you, I would ignore it.

japanese: 私だったらそんなの無視するな。
english: Were I you, I would ignore it.

japanese: もし僕が君なら、彼の忠告に従うだろう。
english: Were I you, I would follow his advice.

japanese: もし僕が君だったら、そんなことはしないよ。
english: If I were you, I wouldn't do it.

japanese: 私だったらやらないけどな。
english: If I were you, I wouldn't do it.

japanese: 私だったらやらないけどなあ。
english: If I were you, I wouldn't do it.

japanese: もしよろしければお手伝いしましょう。
english: If you are busy, I will help you.

japanese: もし文の中で新しい単語に出会えば、それをどうしますか。
english: If you come upon a new word in a sentence, what will you do with it?

japanese: もし負けてもあなたには別の機会が有る。
english: Even if you lose the game, you'll have another chance.

japanese: もし父親の援助がなかったら、彼は事業に失敗していただろう。
english: If it had not been for his father's help, he would have failed in business.

japanese: もし不満があったら知らせてください、調べます。
english: If you have any complaints, let me know, and I'll look into them.

japanese: もし病気の人が千羽の鶴を折ると、その人の願いが叶うの。
english: If a sick person folds one thousand paper cranes, her wish will come true.

japanese: もし病気でないならご一緒するのですが。
english: If I were not ill, I would join you.

japanese: もし百万ドルあれば、どうしますか。
english: What would you do if you had a million dollars?

japanese: もし必要ならば手伝わせて下さい。
english: Let me help you, if necessary.

japanese: もし必要ならば、明日９時に参ります。
english: If necessary, I'll come at nine tomorrow.

japanese: 必要であれば、明日９時に来ますよ。
english: If necessary, I'll come at nine tomorrow.

japanese: もし必要なら、彼に会いに行きます。
english: I'll go and meet him, if it's necessary.

japanese: もし疲れているなら、寝なさい。
english: If you are tired, go to bed.

japanese: もし疲れていなければ彼は行っていただろう。
english: If he hadn't been tired, he would've gone.

japanese: もし彼女の熱が上がったら、お医者さんを呼びにやりなさい。
english: If her temperature goes up, send for the doctor.

japanese: もし彼女の住所氏名を知っていれば、私は彼女に手紙が書けるのだが。
english: If I knew her name and address, I could write to her.

japanese: 彼女の名前と住所がわかれば、手紙を書くことができるのにな。
english: If I knew her name and address, I could write to her.

japanese: もし彼女の住所を知っていれば、手紙を書くのだが。
english: If I knew her address, I would write to her.

japanese: もし彼女の住所がわかっていたなら、彼女を訪問できたのに。
english: If I had known her address, I could have visited her.

japanese: もし彼女に気付いていたら、私はサインをもらっていただろう。
english: If I had noticed her, I would have got her autograph.

japanese: もし彼女が騒ぎ立てなかったら、彼女のお金は戻ってこなかっただろう。
english: If she hadn't made waves about it, she never would have got her money back.

japanese: もし彼女が今出発するなら、間に合うのですが。
english: If she'd set off now, she would make it on time.

japanese: もし彼女が現れなかったらどうなるかなんて、わからない。
english: There is no telling what would happen if she doesn't show up.

japanese: もし彼女がもう少し我慢強かったら、成功していただろうに。
english: With a little more patience, she would have succeeded.

japanese: もし彼女がもう１度フランスを訪れるなら、彼女はそこに３度行ったことになる。
english: If she visits France again, she will have been there three times.

japanese: もし彼女がここにいたら真実を話すのに。
english: If she were here now, I would tell her the truth.

japanese: もし彼女があなたを信用したのだったらそんなことはしなかっただろうに。
english: If she had trusted you, she wouldn't have done so.

japanese: もし彼を利口な人と呼べば、彼は喜ぶかもしれません。
english: If you call him a clever man, he may be happy.

japanese: もし彼を見たら外国人と思うだろう。
english: To look at him, you would take him to be a foreigner.

japanese: もし彼らが花瓶を見つけていなければ、ジョンは窃盗罪で訴えられていただろう。
english: If they hadn't found the vase, John would have been accused of stealing it.

japanese: もし彼の助力がなければ、私は失敗するかもしれない。
english: If it were not for his help, I might fail.

japanese: もし彼の助力がなければ、私は失敗しただろう。
english: If it had not been for his help, I would have failed.

japanese: もし彼の助言がなかったならば、私は失敗していただろう。
english: If it had not been for his advice, I might have failed.

japanese: もし彼の助けがなかったら、彼女はおぼれていただろう。
english: If it hadn't been for his help, she might have drowned.

japanese: 彼の住所を知っていれば手紙を書くのだが。
english: If I knew his address, I would write to him.

japanese: もし彼の住所を知っていれば、手紙を書くだろうに。
english: If I knew his address, I would write to him.

japanese: 彼の住所を知っていれば手紙を書くのに。
english: If I knew his address, I would write to him.

japanese: もし彼の住所を知っていれば、すぐにでも連絡するのだが。
english: If I knew his address, I would get in touch with him right away.

japanese: もし彼の住所を知っていたら手紙をかくだろう。
english: If I had known his address, I would have written.

japanese: もし彼の住所を知っていたら、彼に手紙が書けたのに。
english: As I didn't know his address, I couldn't write to him.

japanese: もし彼の住所を、知っていれば手紙が書けるのだが。
english: If I knew his address, I could write to him.

japanese: もし彼の後押しがあったならば、彼女は市長に選ばれていただろう。
english: With his support, she might have been elected mayor.

japanese: もし彼の救援がなかったら、私たちは事業に失敗していただろう。
english: If it had not been for his help, we would have failed in our enterprise.

japanese: もし彼の援助がなければ、私たちはその計画を実行できないだろう。
english: If it were not for his assistance, we could not carry out the project.

japanese: もし彼の援助がなければ、我々は事業に失敗していただろう。
english: If it had not been for his help, we would have failed in business.

japanese: もし彼のすすめに従っていたら、会社に一銭もなくなっていたかもしれません。
english: The firm might have lost all its money if it had taken his advice.

japanese: もし彼のことをもっとよく知っていたら、彼女は彼と結婚しなかっただろうに。
english: She wouldn't have married him if she had known him better.

japanese: もし彼に十分な時間があったら、よい仕事をしただろうが。
english: If he had enough time, he might have done good work.

japanese: もし彼に会うようなことがあれば、よろしく言っておいてください。
english: If you happen to see him, please give him my best regards.

japanese: もし彼が頼んでくれれば、私達はかれを助けてあげます。
english: We will help him if he asks us.

japanese: もし彼が来られない場合には、君が彼の代わりをしなければならない。
english: You'll have to take his place in case he can't come.

japanese: もし彼が来たら、私を待つように言って下さい。
english: If he comes, tell him to wait for me.

japanese: もし彼が明日来てくれたら、もっと話をする時間があるだろうに。
english: If he came tomorrow, I would have more time to talk.

japanese: もし彼が本当のことを話したら、私は彼を許したのだが。
english: If he had told me the truth, I would have forgiven him.

japanese: もし彼が彼女の腕をつかまえていなかったら、彼女はいけにおちていただろう。
english: She would have fallen into the pond if he had not caught her by the arm.

japanese: 彼が腕をつかんでなかったら、彼女は池に落ちちゃってたよ。
english: She would have fallen into the pond if he had not caught her by the arm.

japanese: もし彼が彼女の電話番号を知っていたら、電話できるのに。
english: If he knew her phone number, he could call her.

japanese: もし彼が彼女の電話番号を知っていたならば、彼女に電話できたのに。
english: If he had known her phone number, he could have called her up.

japanese: もし彼が彼女の忠告をえていたら、彼は成功していただろうに。
english: If he had heard her advice, he would have succeeded.

japanese: もし彼が忠告してくれなかったら、私は成功できなかっただろう。
english: If it hadn't been for his advice, I couldn't have succeeded.

japanese: もし彼が遅れてくるようなら、彼がいなくても会議を始めてよい。
english: If he should arrive late, you may start the conference without him.

japanese: もし彼が正直だったら、私は彼をやとったろう。
english: If he had been honest, I would have employed him.

japanese: あいつが手紙を送ってきても、ビリビリに破いて捨ててやるよ。
english: If he sends me any letters, I just tear them up and throw them away.

japanese: もし彼が私を車に乗せてくれなかったら、今ここに着いていないでしょう。
english: If he had not picked me up, I would not be here now.

japanese: もし彼が死んだらさぞ悲しむだろう。
english: I'll be deeply affected by his death.

japanese: もし彼が罪を犯したのなら、罰せられるべきだ。
english: He ought to be punished if he committed a crime.

japanese: もし彼が月に１回、私からてがみをもらわなかったら、教皇の秘密を世界に発表します。
english: If he doesn't get a letter from me once a month, he will reveal the Pope's secret to the world.

japanese: もし彼が金持ちの生まれであったなら、イギリスに留学したことであろう。
english: Born in a rich family, he would have studied in England.

japanese: もし彼が休んだら、英語のテストはないでしょう。
english: If he is absent, we will not have an English test.

japanese: もし彼が一生懸命働くつもりがないなら、くびだ。
english: If he will not work hard, he will be fired.

japanese: もし彼から何か新しい知らせがあったら私に知らせて下さい。
english: If you hear anything new from him, please let me know about it.

japanese: もし彼がもっと一所懸命に働いていたならば、彼は今では金持ちかもしれないのだが。
english: If he had worked harder, he might be a rich man now.

japanese: もし彼がどうしても来たいというのなら、彼が来るまで待とう。
english: If he will come, I will wait for him till he comes.

japanese: もし彼がその日家にいたら、災難にはあわなかっただろう。
english: If he had stayed at home that day, he would not have met with disaster.

japanese: もし彼がその事実を知っていたら、事故は避けられたであろうに。
english: Had he known the facts, the accident might have been avoided.

japanese: もし彼が事実を知っていたら、事故は避けられただろう。
english: Had he known the facts, the accident might have been avoided.

japanese: もし彼がその事実を知っていたら、私に話してくれただろう。
english: Had he known the truth, he would have told me.

japanese: もし彼がそのとき戦場に行くのを拒否していたら、彼はまだ生きていただろうに。
english: He would still be alive had he refused to go to the battlefield then.

japanese: もし彼がそのことについてしらなければそうは言わないだろう。
english: He would not say so if he didn't know about that.

japanese: もし彼がここにいたら、なんと言うだろう？
english: If he were here, what would he say?

japanese: もし彼がきてくれればさらにいい。
english: If he comes, so much the better.

japanese: もし彼がきたら、私の部屋に通してください。
english: If he comes, show him into my room.

japanese: もし彼があの時注意深かったのなら、その恐ろしい事故は起こらなかっただろう。
english: If he had been careful then, the terrible accident would not have happened.

japanese: もし彼があのように飲み続けるなら、彼は困った事になる。
english: If he carries on drinking like that, he's going to have a problem.

japanese: もし彼が１０時に出発していたなら、今頃ここに着いているだろうに。
english: If he had left at ten, he would have arrived here by now.

japanese: もし買えるだけの金をもっていたら、その本を買っていただろう。
english: If I had had enough money, I would have bought the book.

japanese: もし日本へ来るようなことがあればぜひ会いに来て下さい。
english: If you are ever in Japan, come and see me.

japanese: もし読めるのなら、その本を持っていってよろしい。
english: You may take the book if you can read it.

japanese: もしご都合がよろしければ３時にまいります。
english: I'll come at three o'clock if it is convenient to you.

japanese: もし都合がよかったら今夜ここに来てください。
english: If it's convenient come here tonight.

japanese: もし電話がなったら出てくれますか。
english: If the telephone rings, can you answer it?

japanese: もし電話がなければ、不便だろう。
english: Without telephones, it would be inconvenient.

japanese: もし電話がかかってきたら、居留守を使っておいて。
english: I'm not here if anybody calls.

japanese: もし電話があったら電話番号を聞いておいてください。
english: If anybody calls, get his number.

japanese: もし電気が無かったら我々の文明生活は不可能になるだろう。
english: If it were not for electricity, our civilized life would be impossible.

japanese: 電気のない生活を想像できますか？
english: Can you imagine what our life would be like without electricity?

japanese: もし天候がよければ大集会となろう。
english: The gathering will be large if the weather is good.

japanese: もし天気がよければ、明日行くつもりです。
english: I mean to go tomorrow if the weather is fine.

japanese: もし天気がよければ、ピクニックに行こう。
english: Weather permitting, let's go on a picnic.

japanese: もし鳥だったら私の所に飛んでくるのだが、と彼は言う。
english: He says that if he were a bird he would fly to me.

japanese: もし町にくることがあれば、訪ねてきたまえ。
english: If you ever come to town, come to see me.

japanese: もし地図がなかったら、私は道に迷ってしまっただろう。
english: If it had not been for the map, I would have lost my way.

japanese: もし地震が来たら私たちの街はどうなるだろう。
english: What would become of our city if an earthquake were to hit it?

japanese: もし仮に地震が来たとしたら私たちの町はどうなるのだろうか。
english: What would become of our city if an earthquake were to hit it?

japanese: もし誰か会いに来ても、留守だと言いなさい。
english: If anyone comes to see me, tell him that I am out.

japanese: もし誰かが来たら、留守だといってくれ。
english: If anybody comes, tell him that I am out.

japanese: もし大学へ行きたいならば、もっと英語を勉強しなさい。
english: If you want to go to college, study English harder.

japanese: もし大学に入学できたら、経済学をやるつもりです。
english: If they admit me to the university, I think I will major in economics.

japanese: もし怠けていなかったならば彼は成功しただろうに。
english: But that he was idle, he would have succeeded.

japanese: もし体の調子がよければうかがいます。
english: I will come provided I feel well enough.

japanese: もし体の具合がよければ私は来ます。
english: I will come provided I am well enough.

japanese: もし太陽が西から上がっても、私は計画をあきらめない。
english: If the sun were to rise in the west, I would never give up the plan.

japanese: もし太陽が消滅したら、あらゆる生き物が死ぬだろう。
english: If the sun were to go out, all living things would die.

japanese: もし太陽が消滅したら、生物は皆死ぬだろう。
english: If the sun were to go out, all living things would die.

japanese: もし太陽が輝かなくなれば、生物は皆死ぬだろう。
english: If the sun were to stop shining, all living things would die.

japanese: もし太陽がなければ、地球上の生物はいないだろう。
english: If it were not for the sun, there would be no life on the earth.

japanese: もし太陽がなければ、地球上に生命はないだろう。
english: If it were not for the sun, there would be no life on the earth.

japanese: もし太陽がなければ、われわれは生きられないだろう。
english: If it were not for the sun, we could not live.

japanese: もし太陽がなかったら、我々は生きられないだろう。
english: If it were not for the sun, we could not live.

japanese: 太陽がなければ、あらゆる生き物は死ぬだろう。
english: If it were not for the sun, every living thing would die.

japanese: もし太陽がなければ、すべての生物は死んでしまうだろう。
english: If it were not for the sun, every living thing would die.

japanese: 太陽がなかったら、地上に生物は存在できないだろう。
english: If it were not for the sun, no living creatures could exist on the earth.

japanese: もし太陽がなかったら、地球上の生物は存在できないだろう。
english: If it were not for the sun, no living creatures could exist on the earth.

japanese: 太陽がなければ、我々は生きてゆけないだろう。
english: If it were not for the sun, we could not live at all.

japanese: 太陽がなければ、我々は生きていられないだろう。
english: If it were not for the sun, we could not live at all.

japanese: もし太陽がなかったら、私たちは全く生きられないだろう。
english: If it were not for the sun, we could not live at all.

japanese: もし他の条件が同じならば、簡明な説明がベストだ。
english: Other things being equal, the simplest explanation is the best.

japanese: ほかの条件が同じなら、一番簡単な説明が一番よい。
english: Other things being equal, the simplest explanation is the best.

japanese: もし戦争が起こったら君はどうするか。
english: Supposing war broke out, what would you do?

japanese: もし選手がボールを木に当てれば、作物はみごとに育つということになっていたのです。
english: If a player hit the tree with the ball, it meant that the crops would grow successfully.

japanese: 戦争が起こったら私達はどうなるのだろうか？
english: What will become of us if a war breaks out?

japanese: 戦争が起こったら私たちはどうなるの。
english: What will become of us if a war breaks out?

japanese: 戦争がおこったら我々はどうなるのでしょうか。
english: What will become of us if a war breaks out?

japanese: もし戦争が起こったら、我々はどうなるでしょう。
english: What will become of us if a war breaks out?

japanese: もし生まれ変われたら、金持ちの家の子になりたい。それで何不自由なく暮らしたい。
english: If I could be reborn, I would want to be the child of a rich family, then I'd be set for life.

japanese: もし成功するつもりなら、最善を尽くしなさい。
english: If you are to be successful, you are to do your best.

japanese: 成功するつもりなら一生懸命働かなければならない。
english: If you are to succeed, you must work hard.

japanese: 成功するためには、勤勉でなければならない。
english: If you are to succeed, you must work hard.

japanese: もし成功したいと思うなら、一生懸命働かなければならない。
english: If you are to succeed, you must work hard.

japanese: もし世界のあちこちで私達の隣人が困っていれば援助の手をさしのべよう。
english: If our neighbors around the world are in need, let's lend a helping hand.

japanese: もし水が無ければ、人間は生存できないだろう。
english: If it were not for water, human life would be impossible.

japanese: 水がなければ、何物も生きられないだろう。
english: If it were not for water, nothing could live.

japanese: もし水が無ければ、何物もいきられないだろう。
english: If it were not for water, nothing could live.

japanese: もし水がなければいかなる生き物も生きられないでしょう。
english: If it were not for water, no creature could live.

japanese: もし水がなければ、誰も地球上に住む事はできないだろう。
english: If it were not for water, no one could live on earth.

japanese: もし水がなければ、人間は存続できないだろう。
english: If it were not for water, humans could not survive.

japanese: もし水がなければ、私達は生きていけないだろう。
english: If it were not for water, we could not live.

japanese: もし水がなければ、我々は生きられないだろう。
english: If it were not for water, we could not live.

japanese: もし水がないなら、地上に生物は存在しないだろう。
english: If it were not for water, there would be no life on the earth.

japanese: もし診断書があったらお待ちください。
english: If you have a medical certificate, bring it.

japanese: もし親切でなかったら、彼に取り柄がなくなる。
english: He is nothing, if not kind.

japanese: もし食事したばかりなら泳がない方がいいですよ。
english: You'd better not swim if you've just eaten.

japanese: もし植物がなかったら、我々は生きていけないだろう。
english: If it were not for plants, we wouldn't be able to live.

japanese: もし上手に使えば、お金はずいぶん役に立つ。
english: If wisely used, money can do much.

japanese: もし勝つつもりなら、最善の努力をしなさい。
english: If you are to win, you should do your best.

japanese: もし助言がなかったとしたらあなたは失敗していただろう。
english: But for my advice, you would have failed.

japanese: もし書物がなければどうなると思いますか。
english: What do you think would happen if it were not for books?

japanese: もし十分にお金があれば、そのすてきな車を買うのだが。
english: If I had enough money, I would buy that nice car.

japanese: もし十分なお金を持っていれば、海外へ行けるのに。
english: If I had enough money, I could go abroad.

japanese: 十分なお金があれば海外に行けるのに。
english: If I had enough money, I could go abroad.

japanese: もし収入があと２５％多ければ、わたしは自分の生活にもっと満足するのだが。
english: If I had 25% more income, I'd be more satisfied with my life.

japanese: もし首になったら、最初に何をしますか。
english: Suppose you are fired, what will you do first?

japanese: もし手に余るようなことがあれば、私に助けを求めなさい。
english: If you have any difficulty, ask me for help.

japanese: もし車が無いのなら、彼は事務所にいるはずがない。
english: If the car is gone, he can't be at the office.

japanese: もし車の数が増えると、道路はひどく込むことになるだろう。
english: If the number of cars increases, so will the traffic.

japanese: もし車が故障したら、歩きますよ。
english: If the car breaks down, we'll walk.

japanese: もし車がなければ、彼らはタクシーで来るだろう。
english: If they don't have a car, they'll come by taxi.

japanese: もし時間が許せば博物館を訪れたい。
english: If time permits, I'll visit the museum.

japanese: もし時間があれば来ます。
english: I will come, time permitting.

japanese: もし時間があったら、うちに立ち寄ってください。
english: If you have time, please drop in on us.

japanese: もし試験に落ちていたとしたら、彼はどうしたのだろう。
english: If he had failed the exam, what would he have done?

japanese: もし事故が起きたら、私に報告しなさい。
english: If the accident happens, report to me.

japanese: もし試験がなかったら僕たちの学校生活はなんと楽しいことだろう。
english: If it were not for examinations, how happy our school life would be!

japanese: もし私達が終電に乗り遅れたらどうする？
english: Suppose that we miss the last train, what should we do?

japanese: もし我々が最終列車に乗り遅れるならば、どうするべきだろうか。
english: Suppose that we miss the last train, what should we do?

japanese: もし私の部屋に泥棒が入って来たら、何かを投げつけてやります。
english: If a burglar came into my room, I would throw something at him.

japanese: もし私の身に何か起こったら、ここを調べてみて。
english: If anything should ever happen to me, you can look here.

japanese: 私に万が一のことがあったら、ここを見てね。
english: If anything should ever happen to me, you can look here.

japanese: もし私の助言に従っていたら、きみは今そんな困ったことになっていないのに。
english: If you had taken my advice, you wouldn't be in such trouble.

japanese: もし私の助言がなかったとしたらあなたは失敗していたであろう。
english: If not for my advice, you would have failed.

japanese: もし私の家が大邸宅だったら私の誕生日のパーティーには知人をみんな招待するのだが。
english: If my house were a mansion, I would invite everyone I know to my birthday party.

japanese: もし私に翼があれば、君のところへ飛んでいくのだが。
english: If I had wings, I would fly to you.

japanese: もし私に十分な時間があれば、君と話すだろうに。
english: If I had enough time, I would talk with you.

japanese: もし私に空を飛ぶ翼があったら、彼女を助けに行ったのに。
english: If I had wings to fly, I would have gone to save her.

japanese: 空を飛べる翼があったら彼女を助けに行ったのに。
english: If I had wings to fly, I would have gone to save her.

japanese: もし私に家族がいなければ、こんなに一生懸命に働かないでしょう。
english: But for my family, I would not work so hard.

japanese: もし私に家族がいなかったら、あんなに一生懸命働かなかったことでしょう。
english: But for my family, I would not have worked so hard.

japanese: お金が十分あったら、それを買えたのだが。
english: If I had had enough money, I could have bought it.

japanese: もし私たちみんなが協力すれば、私たちはその国が今おちいっている混乱から救い出せるだろう。
english: If we all pull together we should be able to get the country out of the mess it's in.

japanese: もし私たちが平和な生活を求めるなら、戦争に反対せざるを得ない。
english: If we want a peaceful life, we cannot help objecting to war.

japanese: もし私たちが彼をそんなにひどく扱うなら、それは不公平だろう。
english: It would be unfair if we treated him so badly.

japanese: もし私たちがそこへ行けるのだったらすばらしいでしょうね。
english: It would be splendid if we could go there, wouldn't it?

japanese: もし私が戻らなければ、その事業は成功しないだろう。
english: If I don't come back, the venture will probably be unsuccessful.

japanese: 彼の住所を知っていたら、手紙を書いたのだが。
english: If I had known his address, I would have written to him.

japanese: もし私が鳥ならば、あなたのところへ飛んでいくのに。
english: Were I a bird, I would fly to you.

japanese: もし私が鳥ならば、君のところへ飛んで行けるのだが。
english: If I were a bird, I could fly to you.

japanese: もし私が遅れたら、待たないでくれ。
english: In case I am late, you don't have to wait for me.

japanese: 私が遅れたら、待たなくていいからね。
english: In case I am late, you don't have to wait for me.

japanese: もし私が男の子ならば、野球部にはいることが出来るのに。
english: If I were a boy, I could join a baseball team.

japanese: もし私が若い頃一生懸命に働いていたならば、今頃は成功しているだろうに。
english: If I had worked hard in my youth, I would be successful now.

japanese: 真実を知っていれば、君に話すだろう。
english: If I knew the truth, I would tell you.

japanese: 私は、本当のことを知っていればあなたに話すのだが。
english: If I knew the truth, I would tell you.

japanese: もし私が事実を知っていたら、言うだろう。
english: If I knew the truth, I would tell you.

japanese: 本当のこと知ってたら言うって。
english: If I knew the truth, I would tell you.

japanese: もし私が死んだら、私の家族は何をするのだろう。
english: If I were to die, what would my family do?

japanese: もし私が君の立場なら、彼を手伝ってやるだろうに。
english: If I were in your place, I would lend him a hand.

japanese: もし私が君の立場なら、その計画に反対するだろう。
english: Were I in your position, I would oppose that plan.

japanese: もし私が君の立場だったら、そうはしないだろう。
english: If I were in your place, I would not do so.

japanese: もし私が君のねらいに気付いていれば、賛成なんかしなかったのに。
english: Had I realized what you intended, I wouldn't have agreed.

japanese: 私だったらそんなことしないけどなぁ。
english: If I were you, I wouldn't do such a thing.

japanese: 私なら、そんなことはしないでしょう。
english: If I were you, I should not do such a thing.

japanese: 私が一緒だったら助けてあげられたのにね。
english: If I had been with you, I could have helped you.

japanese: もし私が君だったらすぐ帰宅するだろう。
english: If I were you, I would go home at once.

japanese: もし私が金持ちならば留学するんだが、ところが実際はそうすることが出来ない。
english: If I were rich, I would study abroad, but as it is I can't do so.

japanese: もし私が金持ちならば、立派な家を買うのだが。
english: If I were rich, I would buy a fine house.

japanese: もし私が暇だったら君を手伝うことができるのに。
english: If I were free, I could help you.

japanese: もし暇だったら手伝えるのに。
english: If I were free, I could help you.

japanese: 時間があればなあ、手伝ってあげられるんだけど。
english: If I were free, I could help you.

japanese: もし私がそれを知っているなら、私はそれをあなたに告げるだろう。
english: If I knew it, I would tell it to you.

japanese: もし私がひまであれば、彼の招待を受けるのだが。
english: If I were free, I would accept his invitation.

japanese: 知っていれば教えてあげたんだけど。
english: If I had known it, I would have told it to you.

japanese: もし私がそれを知っていたとしたら、私はそれをあなたに言っただろうに。
english: If I had known it, I would have told it to you.

japanese: もし私がその事を知っていたら、計画を変更していただろう。
english: If I had known about it, I would have changed my plan.

japanese: もし私がそのことを知っていたら、君に話していただろうに。
english: Had I known about it, I would have told you.

japanese: 知っていたら、お話したのですが。
english: Had I known about it, I would have told you.

japanese: もし私がお金持ちであったなら、君に少しお金をあげたのですが。
english: If I had been rich, I would have given you some money.

japanese: お金を持っていれば買えるんですが。
english: If I had enough money, I could buy it.

japanese: もし私があの時その絵を買っていたら、今では金持ちだろうに。
english: If I had bought the painting then, I would be rich now.

japanese: もし私があのときその絵を買っていれば、今では金持ちだっただろうに。
english: If I had bought the painting then, I would be rich now.

japanese: もし私があなたの立場なら同じ事をするでしょう。
english: Were I in your place I would do the same thing.

japanese: もし私があなたの立場なら、彼女を信用する。
english: If I were you, I would trust her.

japanese: 私があなたなら、彼女を信用すると思う。
english: If I were you, I would trust her.

japanese: 私があなたの立場だったら、それをすぐにするでしょう。
english: Were I in your position, I would do it at once.

japanese: もし私があなたの立場なら、すぐにそれをやるのでしょう。
english: Were I in your position, I would do it at once.

japanese: もし私があなたの立場だったら、仕事をやめてロンドンにでるでしょう。
english: If I were you, I would quit my job and leave London.

japanese: もし私があなたなら、彼の申し出を受けるでしょうに。
english: If I were you, I would accept his offer.

japanese: もし私があなたならば、そんなに困難な状況においては同じことをするだろう。
english: If I were you, I would have done the same thing in such a difficult situation.

japanese: もし私があなたなら、奨学金の申し込みをするのですが。
english: If I were you, I would apply for the scholarship.

japanese: もし私があなたなら、もっと体に気をつけるだろう。
english: I would be more careful if I were you.

japanese: 僕が君ならそうはしないね。
english: I wouldn't do that if I were you.

japanese: もし私があなたであるならそんなことはしないでしょう。
english: I wouldn't do that if I were you.

japanese: もし私があなただったらそれをしないでしょう。
english: I wouldn't do it if I were you.

japanese: もし子供が毒を飲んだら病院に急いで連れて行きなさい。
english: If your child drinks poison, rush him to the hospital.

japanese: もし仕事がなく暇なら、私はこれらの本を読めるのだが。
english: Were I free from work, I could read these books.

japanese: もし酸素がなかったら、すべての動物はとうに消滅していただろう。
english: Without oxygen, all animals would have disappeared long ago.

japanese: もし最終打者がホームランを打たなかったら、我がチームは試合に負けていただろう。
english: If our last batter had not finally hit a home run, our team would have lost the game.

japanese: もし困った事があればユーザーズガイドにあたってください。
english: Refer to the Users' Guide if you have any problems.

japanese: お困りの点がありましたら、利用者マニュアルをご参照ください。
english: Refer to the Users' Guide if you have any problems.

japanese: もし今彼女がここにいたら、真実を話せるのに。
english: If she were here now, I could tell her the truth.

japanese: もし今彼のお父さんがいなければ、彼は貧乏していることだろう。
english: If his father wasn't there, he'd be poor right now.

japanese: もし今日が日曜日なら、私たちは釣りに行くのだが。
english: If it were Sunday today, we would go fishing.

japanese: もし今日が日曜日なら、私は釣りにいくのだが。
english: If today was Sunday, I would go fishing.

japanese: もし今飲まなければ、あなたのお茶は冷めますよ。
english: Your tea will get cold if you don't drink it now.

japanese: もし今、私が１００万円持っていたら、車を買うであろう。
english: If I had one million yen now, I would buy a car.

japanese: もし高い丘がＡからＢの間にあれば、路線が丘を越えて行くようにさせるか、トンネルで丘を貫いて行くようにさせるか、あるいは丘を避けて迂回路をとるようにさせるか決めるのが重要となる。
english: If a high hill stood between A and B, it was important to decide whether the line should climb over it, pierce it with a tunnel, or make a detour to avoid it.

japanese: もし行きたければ行ってもよろしい。
english: You can go if you want to.

japanese: 行きたければ行けば。
english: You can go if you want to.

japanese: 行きたいんだったら、行ってもいいよ。
english: You can go if you want to.

japanese: もし工場が来年完成するのなら、新しい製造部長を雇わなければならない。
english: If the plant is completed next year, a new production manager will have to be hired.

japanese: もし現代音楽が好きでないのなら、君はこの音楽会を楽しめないでしょう。
english: If you have no liking for modern music, you will not enjoy this concert.

japanese: もし鍵を紛失すれば、私は戸締まりができない。
english: If I lost my key, I wouldn't be able to lock the door.

japanese: 鍵をなくしちゃったら、ドアに鍵をかけられないよな。
english: If I lost my key, I wouldn't be able to lock the door.

japanese: もし見落としのために未払いになっているのでしたら、お支払いいただいて、この問題を早急に片づけさせてください。
english: If an oversight is the reason why you have not paid, please send us the amount due, and let us solve the problem immediately.

japanese: もし見つかったら彼はひどい目にあうだろう。
english: It will go hard with him if he is found out.

japanese: もし建物の取り壊しが無制限に行われるなら、美しい町が単なるコンクリート・ジャングルになる危険があるのである。
english: If the demolition of buildings is uncontrolled, a fine city is in danger of becoming nothing more than a concrete jungle.

japanese: もし健康なら研究を続けられるのに。
english: If I were in good health, I could pursue my studies.

japanese: もし健康ならハイキングに行けるのに。
english: If I were healthy, I could go on a hike.

japanese: もし計画について知っていたら、私は彼の手助けができたのに。
english: If I had known about the plan, I could have helped him.

japanese: もし君の立場にいたら、私はそんなことはしないだろう。
english: If I were in your place, I wouldn't do such a thing.

japanese: もし君の助けがなければ、彼は失敗していただろう。
english: But for your help, he would have failed.

japanese: もし君の助けがなかったら、父は失敗しただろう。
english: If it had not been for your help, my father would have failed.

japanese: もし君の助けがなかったなら、その仕事を完成できなかっただろう。
english: If it had not been for your help, I couldn't have completed the work.

japanese: あなたの助けがなければ、私は成功できないでしょう。
english: If it were not for your help, I could not succeed.

japanese: もし君の助けがあるならば、私は成功できるでしょう。
english: With your help, I could succeed.

japanese: もし君の住所を知っていれば、彼女は君に手紙を書くだろうに。
english: If she knew your address, she would write to you.

japanese: もし君の援助がなかったら、私はこの店を経営できないだろう。
english: If it were not for your help, I could not run this store.

japanese: もし君が彼を見たら、女の子だと思うだろう。
english: To look at him, you'd take him for a girl.

japanese: 成功する為には懸命に働かなければならない。
english: You must work hard if you are to succeed.

japanese: 成功しようと思えば一生懸命働かなければならない。
english: You must work hard if you are to succeed.

japanese: もし君が成功するつもりならば熱心に勉強しなければならない。
english: You must work hard if you are to succeed.

japanese: あなたが成功するつもりでいるのなら、一生懸命働かなければならない。
english: You must work hard if you are to succeed.

japanese: もし君が自分の夢を実現させようと思うなら、もっと懸命に働かなければならない。
english: If you are to realize your dream, you must work harder.

japanese: もし君が時間通りにしたければ、１１時までにそこに着くべきだ。
english: If you want to be on time, you should be there by 11 o'clock.

japanese: もし君が試験に合格したいのなら、一生懸命に勉強しなければならない。
english: If you are to succeed in the exam, you must study hard.

japanese: もし君が私を助けてくれていたら、私はその仕事を成し遂げることができただろう。
english: If you had helped me, I could have accomplished the work.

japanese: もし君が私と一緒に行かないのなら、私は行きたくない。
english: I don't want to go if you don't go with me.

japanese: 一緒に行ってくれないんだったら、行きたくない。
english: I don't want to go if you don't go with me.

japanese: 一緒に来てくれないんなら、行くの嫌だ。
english: I don't want to go if you don't go with me.

japanese: もし君が私たちを助けてくれるなら、大変うれしい。
english: If you will help us, we will be very glad.

japanese: もし君が原始社会の一員で、たとえば食料を生産したいと思うならば、君がしなければならないことが二つある。
english: If you are a member of a primitive community and you wish to produce, say, food, there are two things that you must do.

japanese: もし君が急げば、すぐに彼女に追いつくでしょう。
english: If you hurry, you will soon overtake her.

japanese: もし君がヘルメットをかぶらないでバイクに乗るんだと言い張るんだったら、それは危険なことになるぞ。
english: You're playing with fire if you insist on riding your motorcycle without a helmet on.

japanese: もし君がその事実を知るようなことがあれば驚くだろう。
english: Were you to know the fact you would be surprised.

japanese: もし君がずっと走っていたら、そこへ間に合って着いただろうに。
english: Had you run all the way, you'd have got there in time.

japanese: もし君がここに駐車していたなら、罰金を科せられていただろう。
english: If you had parked your car here, you would have been fined.

japanese: もし君がここにいてくれたら、そのことを相談できるのに。
english: If only you were here, I could consult you about it.

japanese: もし君があのバスに乗りそこなっていたら、今ここにはいないんだろうに。
english: If you had missed that bus, you might not be here now.

japanese: もし君が１０００万円持ってたとしたら、どうするだろう。
english: Suppose you had ten million yen, what would you do?

japanese: もし君が１０００万円持っていたら、どうするだろうか。
english: Suppose you had ten million yen, what would you do?

japanese: もし、君が１千万円もっていたとしたらどうするだろう。
english: Suppose you had ten million yen, what would you do?

japanese: もし空気と水がなければなにものも生きていけない。
english: If it were not for air and water, nothing could live.

japanese: もし空気と水がなければ、生物は何も存在しないだろう。
english: If it were not for air and water, nothing alive would exist.

japanese: もし空気がなければ、飛行機は飛ぶことができないだろう。
english: If it were not for the air, planes could not fly.

japanese: もし銀行へ行っていればもっとよい交換レートだったのに。
english: They would have gotten a better exchange rate if they had gone to a bank.

japanese: もし金持ちになったらそれを買うんだが。
english: If I got rich, I would buy it.

japanese: もし金があれば、それが買えるのに。
english: If I had money, I could buy it.

japanese: 私にお金があれば買うことができるのに。
english: If I had money, I could buy it.

japanese: もし緊急用食料が数日中にそこに到達しなければ、何千人もの命が危険になるだろう。
english: Thousands of lives will be at stake if emergency food does not arrive there within a few days.

japanese: もし緊急なことがあれば、私に連絡して下さい。
english: If there's anything urgent, you can get in touch with me.

japanese: 緊急の時は私に連絡すればいいからね。
english: If there's anything urgent, you can get in touch with me.

japanese: もし急げばあなたは彼に追いつくだろう。
english: If you hurry, you will catch up with him.

japanese: もし急ぐならば、あなたは彼に追い付くでしょう。
english: If you hurry, you will overtake him.

japanese: もし気分が悪くなったら、私に知らせて下さい。
english: Let me know in case you feel sick.

japanese: もし気を付けなければ彼女はそんなことをしているうちに靭帯を切ってしまうだろう。
english: If she's not careful she'll tear a ligament doing that.

japanese: 万一考えを変えることがあったら、私に知らせて下さい。
english: Should you change your mind, let me know.

japanese: もし気がかわったら、知らせてください。
english: Should you change your mind, let me know.

japanese: もし帰宅したければ帰ってよい。
english: You may go home if you want to.

japanese: 帰りたいなら帰っても構いません。
english: You may go home if you want to.

japanese: もし期限切れになったら、大変なことになるよ。
english: There will be hell to pay if I don't make this deadline.

japanese: 私の言うことが間違っていたら訂正して下さい。
english: Correct me if I am wrong.

japanese: もし間違っていたら正して下さい。
english: Correct me if I am wrong.

japanese: 私が間違えたときは言ってください。
english: Correct me if I am wrong.

japanese: もし間違えたら笑われるのではないか、と彼は心配しているようだ。
english: He seems to be afraid of being laughed at if he makes a mistake.

japanese: もし患者に意識がなければ、その患者の家族が決めていいのです。
english: If the patient is unconscious, the family can make the decision.

japanese: もし核戦争になったら、われわれの子孫はどうなるのでしょう。
english: What will become of our offspring if a nuclear war breaks out?

japanese: もし皆の援助がなかったら、私は試験に合格しなかったでしょう。
english: But for everybody's support, I would not have passed the examination.

japanese: もし花瓶がみつからなければ、ジョンがそれを盗んだということで責められるだろう。
english: If the vase is not found, John may be accused of stealing it.

japanese: もし火事が起きたら、私はフルートをもって逃げるだろう。
english: If a fire should break out, I would make off with my flute.

japanese: もし暇があれば、私はフランス語を勉強するのだが。
english: If I had time, I would study French.

japanese: 時間があったらフランス語の勉強するんだけどな。
english: If I had time, I would study French.

japanese: もし何か上手く行かなければ、私がその結果に対して責任をとります。
english: If anything goes wrong, I'll answer for the consequences.

japanese: もし何か起こったら、すぐに電話をください。
english: In case anything happens, call me immediately.

japanese: もし仮に外国に住むことになれば、イギリスに住むだろう。
english: If I were to live abroad, I would live in Britain.

japanese: もし鉛筆がいるのなら、貸してあげよう。
english: If you want a pencil, I'll lend you one.

japanese: 鉛筆がいるなら、貸してあげるよ。
english: If you want a pencil, I'll lend you one.

japanese: もし遠回りでなければポストに入れてください。
english: Please drop it in the mail if it's not out of your way.

japanese: もし嘘なら、彼女はうそつきだ。
english: If that's false, she's a liar.

japanese: もし雨になったら洗濯物を取り込んでね。
english: If it rains, take the washing in.

japanese: もし雨なら遠足は中止です。
english: If it rains, the excursion will be called off.

japanese: もし雨ならば、私たちはハイキングにいかないつもりです。
english: If it's raining, we don't plan to go hiking.

japanese: もし雨が降れば私は出発を延期します。
english: I will put off my departure if it rains.

japanese: もし雨が降ったらどうしたらいいのでしょうか。
english: Suppose it rains, what shall we do?

japanese: もし宇宙人と出会ったらどうするかね。
english: What would you do if you saw a man from another planet?

japanese: もし一ヶ月でこのタイプライターを完全に使いこなせたら、きみのものにしておいてもよい。
english: If you can use this typewriter perfectly in a month, you may keep it.

japanese: もし偉大な本がなければ、我々の生活はもっとつまらなくなるだろう。
english: If it were not for great books, our lives would be much the poorer.

japanese: もし安全ベルトがなかったら、私は今日生きていないだろう。
english: But for the safety belt, I wouldn't be alive today.

japanese: もし今日中にロンドンに着きたければ、今出発すべきでしょうね。
english: If he wanted to get to London today, he should leave now.

japanese: もしよろしければ、日本滞在中に歌舞伎を見に行きませんか。
english: I am wondering if you would like to go and see kabuki with me while staying in Japan.

japanese: もしよければ、今度の土曜日にうちに遊びに来てください。
english: Please come to my house next Saturday if you care to.

japanese: もしよかったら、今度の週末までなんだけど。
english: Until next weekend, if that's OK.

japanese: もしよかったら、一緒にお昼いかがですか。
english: I'd like to invite you to lunch, if you're not busy.

japanese: お時間があるようなら、ご一緒にランチはいかがですか？
english: I'd like to invite you to lunch, if you're not busy.

japanese: もしよかったら、コーヒーでも入れてくれませんか。
english: Would you mind terribly making me a cup of coffee?

japanese: もしも無料でしたら１部コピーしてください。
english: If it is free, please send me a copy.

japanese: もしも無料でなければ、カタログの価格と日本までの送料をお教えください。
english: If they are not free, please let me know how much the catalogue and the postage to Japan are.

japanese: もしも別の部屋の予約をご希望でしたら、大至急ご連絡下さい。
english: If you wish us to reserve an alternative room, please let us know immediately.

japanese: もしも平和が名誉をもって維持されるのでなければ、それはもはや平和ではない。
english: If peace cannot be maintained with honor, it is no longer peace.

japanese: もしも彼が本当のことを話してくれたら、わたしは彼を許したのだが。
english: If he told me the truth, I would have forgiven him.

japanese: もしも脳が死んでいたら、その患者を死なせてあげるべきです。
english: If the brain is dead, we should let the patient die.

japanese: もしも地図を持っていたならば、彼は道に迷わなかったろうに。
english: If he had carried the map with him, he wouldn't have got lost.

japanese: もしも全額お支払いいただけないのでしたら、１９９８年１０月２８日までにご連絡ください。
english: If you cannot make full remittance, please get in touch with me by October 28, 1998.

japanese: もしも神が存在しないのならば、神を造り出す必要があろう。
english: If God did not exist, it would be necessary to invent him.

japanese: もしも十分に金があったなら、私はそのかばんを買っただろうに。
english: If I had had enough money, I would have bought the bag.

japanese: もしも私が本当のことを話すようなことがあれば、彼は怒るだろう。
english: If I were to tell him the truth, he would be angry.

japanese: もしも私が生まれ変わるなら、鳥になりたい。
english: If I were to be reborn, I would like to be a bird.

japanese: もしも私が一言にして生命の定義を下さなければならないとするならば、生命とは創造であるということである。
english: If I had to define life in a word, it would be: Life is creation.

japanese: もしも叶うなら、私は失った時間の埋め合わせをしたい。
english: If I could have a wish, I'd wish I could make up for lost time.

japanese: もし何か困ったことがあったら、遠慮なく私のところに来てください。
english: If you should have any trouble, don't hesitate to come to me.

japanese: もしも一時的な財政上の問題でお支払いが遅れているのでしたら、私どもにご連絡ください。
english: If you are having temporary financial problems and it is the cause of your outstanding account, let us know about it.

japanese: もしもわからないことがおこったら、私のところに来なさい。
english: If anything comes up that you don't understand, come to me.

japanese: もしものときのために、お金は多少蓄えておいたほうがいいよ。
english: You'd better put aside some money for a rainy day.

japanese: もしもっと早く家を出ていたら、君はラッシュアワーにぶつからなかったのに。
english: You'd not have been in the rush hour if you had left home earlier.

japanese: もしもっと頑張っていれば、彼は成功できただろうに。
english: Had he worked harder, he could have succeeded.

japanese: もしもっと時間があれば、ダンスを習うだろうに。
english: If I had more time, I would learn how to dance.

japanese: もしもそなたの愛を失うならば、私は自分のもつ全てを失う。
english: And if I lose thy love, I lose my all.

japanese: もしもその機械が壊れたら、君が悪いんだよ。
english: If the machine is damaged, you are responsible.

japanese: もしもし、ジョンソンさんをお願いします。
english: Hello. May I speak to Mr Johnson, please?

japanese: もしもし、ジョー・カールトンですが、マイケル君をお願いしたいのですが。
english: Hello. This is Joe Carlton. May I speak to Michael?

japanese: もしもし、ジョー・カールトンですが、マイケル君をお願いします。
english: Hello. This is Joe Carlton. May I speak to Michael?

japanese: もしもし。小川ですが。
english: Hello. This is Ogawa speaking.

japanese: もしもし、来ていますか。
english: Are you there?

japanese: そこにいるの？
english: Are you there?

japanese: もしもし、料金不足ですよ。
english: Excuse me. That fare is not enough.

japanese: もしもし、僕だけど、駅まで迎えに来てくれないかい？
english: Hello, it's me. Could you come pick me up at the station?

japanese: もしもし、日本から来た佐藤智子です。
english: Hello, I'm Tomoko Sato from Japan.

japanese: もしもし、人事課ですか？
english: Hello, is this the personnel department?

japanese: もしもし、後藤さんのお宅ですか。
english: Hello. Is this the Gotos' residence?

japanese: もしもし、会計士はいますか。
english: Hello, is the accountant there, please?

japanese: もしもし、何か手伝うことがありますか。
english: Excuse me, but do you need any help?

japanese: もしもし、何かお役に立ちましょうか。
english: Excuse me, but do you need any help?

japanese: あのう、何かお困りですか？
english: Excuse me, but do you need any help?

japanese: もしもし、フリーマン氏はおられますか。
english: Hello, is Mr Freeman in?

japanese: もしもし、こちらはマイクです。
english: Hello, this is Mike.

japanese: もしもし、カナダのウィニペグに電話をしたいんです。番号はちょっとわからないんですけど。
english: Operator, I'd like to place a call to Winnipeg, Canada, but I can't quite remember the number.

japanese: もしもご質問に全部お答えしていないのでしたら、ご連絡ください。
english: If we have not covered all the questions you asked, please inform us.

japanese: もしもクレオパトラの鼻がもっと低かったら、世界の歴史は変わっていただろう。
english: If Cleopatra's nose had been shorter, the whole face of the world would have been changed.

japanese: もしもう少しがまん強ければ、きみは成功していただろう。
english: With a little more patience, you would have succeeded.

japanese: もう少し根気があったら成功していただろう。
english: With a little more patience, you would have succeeded.

japanese: もう少し我慢していたらうまくいっただろうに。
english: With a little more patience, you would have succeeded.

japanese: もしもあなたの忠告がなかったならば、私は事業で失敗していたでしょう。
english: If it had not been for your advice, I would have failed in my business.

japanese: もしも別の方法でお手伝いできることがありましたら、ご連絡ください。
english: Please let us know if we can be of help in other ways.

japanese: もしも、単なる手落ちでお支払いが遅れているのでしたら、早急に対処してくださいますか。
english: If the delay is simply an oversight, will you please take care of it at once?

japanese: もしも、私どもの製品の新しい市場を開拓していただく助けになるのでしたら、５％の値引きに応じます。
english: We accept making a reduction in price of 5% if this will help you to develop a new market for our products.

japanese: もしも、音楽が愛の糧であるならば、奏で続けよ。
english: If music be the food of love, play on.

japanese: もしも、私が差し上げられる情報があったり、何かご質問がありましたらご連絡ください。
english: Please let me know if I can provide you with any further information, or if you would like to contact me for questions.

japanese: もしも、すでに出荷されているのでしたらこのメールは無視してください。
english: Please disregard this notice if your shipment has already been made.

japanese: もしも、すでにお支払い済みでしたら、どうぞこのメールは無視してください。
english: Should you have settled the account since this mail was written, please ignore our reminder.

japanese: もしも、このコンピューターを使いたいのでしたら、大至急ご連絡下さい。
english: Please let me know immediately if you would like to use this computer.

japanese: もしメアリーが泳ぎ方を知っていたら、海辺に行く回数が増えるだろう。
english: If Mary knew how to swim, she would go to the beach more often.

japanese: もしボブが私の忠告を聞いていたら、何もかもうまくいってるのに。
english: If Bob had taken my advice, everything would be all right now.

japanese: もしぶどう酒がもっとほしければ、地下室へ行ってとっておいで。
english: If you want any more wine, go to the cellar and get some.

japanese: もしひょっとして家を買いたいという人のうわさを聞いたら、知らせてください。
english: If you happen to hear of anybody that wants to buy a house, please let me know.

japanese: 誰か家を買いたいって人がいたら、教えてくださいね。
english: If you happen to hear of anybody that wants to buy a house, please let me know.

japanese: もしひまがあれば、彼は来るでしょう。
english: If he has time, he will come.

japanese: 時間があれば、来るよ。
english: If he has time, he will come.

japanese: もしパーティーを開くなら私も仲間に入れて下さい。
english: If you are going to have a party, please count me in.

japanese: もしできたら手助けしてあげよう。
english: I will help you if possible.

japanese: もしだめでも、いつでも彼に援助を求めればよい。
english: If you fail, you can always ask for his help.

japanese: もしそれを知っていたらなら、私はその事をあなたに話しただろう。
english: Had I known it, I'd have told you about that.

japanese: もしそれを知っていたなら、私はそこへ行っただろうに。
english: If I had known it, I would have gone there.

japanese: もしそれをするつもりならば、よいスタートをきらなければならない。
english: If you are to do it, you must make a good start.

japanese: もしそれに申し込むなら親の許可がいる。
english: You need your parents' permission if you are going to apply for that.

japanese: もしそれが本当ならどうしますか。
english: Suppose it were true, what would you do?

japanese: もしそれが本当なら、中川は有罪であるということになる。
english: If it is true, it follows that Nakagawa is guilty.

japanese: もしそれが許されると知っていたら、私は税金など払わなかっただろう。
english: If I thought I could get away with it, I wouldn't pay tax at all.

japanese: もしその知らせを聞けば、彼は喜ぶでしょう。
english: He would be very glad to hear the news.

japanese: もしその男を見つけたらすぐに私に知らせて下さい。
english: If you find the man, please let me know at once.

japanese: もしその洗濯機の調子がまた狂ったら、製造会社に文句を言ってやろう。
english: If that washing machine goes wrong again, I shall complain to the manufacturer.

japanese: もしその時医者の忠告に従っていなかったならば、今頃君は病気かもしれないだろう。
english: If you had not followed the doctor's advice then, you might be ill now.

japanese: もしその事故がなかったら、時間に間に合っただろう。
english: If it had not been for the accident, we would have been in time.

japanese: もしその事件を調査するならば、少なくとも３週間はかかるだろう。
english: To investigate the incident would take us at least three weeks.

japanese: もしその光景を見たら君は気が変になるだろう。
english: If you see it, you'll go bananas.

japanese: もし、その光景を見たら君はおかしくなるだろう。
english: If you see it, you'll go bananas.

japanese: もしその医者の治療がなかったら、その患者は生きていないだろう。
english: But for the doctor's care, the patient would not be alive.

japanese: もしそのニュースを知っていたら、君に言っただろうに。
english: If I had known the news, I would have told you.

japanese: もしそのなぞなぞに答えられなければ彼は食べられてしまうだろう。
english: If he could not answer the riddle, he would be eaten.

japanese: お金を貸してくださるなら、大変ありがたく存じます。
english: If you will lend me the money, I shall be much obliged to you.

japanese: もしそのお金がなかったら、私たちは成功しなかっただろう。
english: Had it not been for the money, we would not have succeeded.

japanese: もしそのお金があれば、世界一周旅行をするのだが。
english: If I had the money, I would make a trip around the world.

japanese: もしそこに彼がいあわせたなら、あなたの伝言を伝えられたでしょうに。
english: If he had been there, I could have given him your message.

japanese: もし彼がそこにいたら、あなたのメッセージを伝えることができたのにね。
english: If he had been there, I could have given him your message.

japanese: もしスポーツがなければ学校生活はなんとつまらないものだろう。
english: If it were not for sports, how dull school life would be!

japanese: もしすべてが彼女の計画通りに進むなら、彼女は引っ張りだこだろう。
english: If all went according to her plan, she would be in great demand.

japanese: もしスーが飛行機できているなら、まもなく着くはずだ。
english: If Sue is coming by air, she ought to arrive very soon.

japanese: もし邪魔だったら、そう言ってくれ。
english: Please tell me if I get in your way.

japanese: もしジェーンのお母さんが日本にいれば、ひな祭りに招待できるのに。
english: If Jane's mother were in Japan, I could invite her to the Doll's Festival.

japanese: もしご迷惑でなければ今晩お伺いしたいのですが。
english: I should like to call on you this evening.

japanese: もしご質問があればお知らせください。
english: If you have any questions, please let me know.

japanese: もしコンピューターがなければ、私たちの生活はどんなに不便だろう。
english: If it were not for the computer, how inconvenient our lives would be!

japanese: もしこんなことを続けていたら、彼は刑務所に入るはめになるぞ。
english: If he carries on like this, he's going to wind up in prison.

japanese: もしこれが間違っていると思ったら遠慮なく言いなさい。
english: If you think this is wrong, you must speak out.

japanese: もしこの提案が実施されれば、実業界は相当影響を受けるであろう。
english: If this proposal is put into practice, the business world will be affected to a significant degree.

japanese: もしこの調子でやっていくなら困難な目にあうだろう。
english: We're going to find ourselves in difficulty if we carry on like this.

japanese: もしこの仕事に就きたいのならば、明日までに申し込まなければなりません。
english: If you want this job, you must apply for it by tomorrow.

japanese: もしここで英語を勉強していなければ、彼女はその試験に受からなかっただろう。
english: If she had not studied English here, she could not have passed the examination.

japanese: もしコーヒーが濃すぎれば、いくらかお湯を足して下さい。
english: If the coffee is too strong, add some more water.

japanese: もしコーヒーが苦かったら、砂糖をふやしてください。
english: If your coffee is too strong, add some sugar.

japanese: もしケーキをひとつでも食べたら、ぶつからね。
english: If you eat any cake, I'll whip you.

japanese: もしグレースが熱心に勉強しなかったら、きっと試験に失敗していただろう。
english: If Grace had not studied so hard, she would surely have failed the test.

japanese: もし彼が来られない場合、君が代わりをしなければならない。
english: You will have to take his place in case he cannot come.

japanese: もしかれが正直だったら、彼らは雇ったのだが。
english: If he had been honest, they would have employed him.

japanese: もしかねが十分あればその本を買うんだが。
english: If I had enough money, I would buy the book.

japanese: 明日は雨になるかもしれない。
english: It might rain tomorrow.

japanese: もしかすると明日雨が降るかもしれない。
english: It might rain tomorrow.

japanese: 明日は雨かもしれない。
english: It might rain tomorrow.

japanese: 明日は雨が降るかもしれません。
english: It might rain tomorrow.

japanese: 明日は雨かもね。
english: It might rain tomorrow.

japanese: もしかすると彼は明日来るかもしれない。
english: He might come tomorrow.

japanese: 明日、あいつ来るかもしれないよ。
english: He might come tomorrow.

japanese: もしかしてあなたのタイプ貸してもらえるかしら。
english: Is there any chance of my borrowing your typewriter?

japanese: もしかして、食卓の上に置きっぱなし？冷蔵庫に入れておかないと、腐っちゃうよ。
english: Hey, has this been sitting out on the dinner table all day? It has to go in the refrigerator or it'll go bad.

japanese: もしかして、ここから町へ行く道をご存じではないでしょうか。
english: Do you happen to know how to get downtown from here?

japanese: もしかしたら夕方にならないうちに雨かもしれないよ。
english: It might rain before evening.

japanese: ひょっとすると夕方前に雨になるかもしれない。
english: It might rain before evening.

japanese: 夕方前には雨が降るかもね。
english: It might rain before evening.

japanese: もしかしたら彼は気が変わるかもしれない。
english: He might change his mind.

japanese: 私は君を誤解していたようですね。
english: It occurs to me that I may have misunderstood you.

japanese: もしかしたら君を誤解していたのかもしれないとふと思う。
english: It occurs to me that I may have misunderstood you.

japanese: ふと思うのだが、私は君を誤解していたかもしれない。
english: It occurs to me that I may have misunderstood you.

japanese: もしかこの方面に来るようなことがあったらお寄りください。
english: If you come this way by any chance, drop in to see me.

japanese: もしお金をたくさん持っていたらその辞書を買うのだがと彼は言った。
english: He said that if he had much money, he would buy the dictionary.

japanese: もしお金が入用なら、いくらかお貸ししましょう。
english: If you need any money, I'll lend you some.

japanese: もしお金が欲しいなら、貸してあげるよ。
english: If you want any money, I will lend you some.

japanese: お金がいるなら貸してあげましょう。
english: If you want any money, I will lend you some.

japanese: もしお金があれば、そのカメラが買えるのだが。実のところは買えない。
english: If I had money, I would buy that camera. As it is, I cannot buy it.

japanese: もしお金がないのなら、なしで済まさなければならない。
english: If you don't have money, you have to do without.

japanese: もしおまえがひとりで来たらうんとおこってやらなきゃならないかもしれない。
english: I might have to be very angry with you if you were to come alone.

japanese: もしおばあちゃんが来なければ子ども達はがっかりするだろう。
english: If Grandma doesn't come, the children will be disappointed.

japanese: もしオゾン層がなければ、私たちは危機に直面しているだろう。
english: Without the ozone layer, we would be in danger.

japanese: もしある期間家を離れる場合は郵便の配達を止めてもらう。
english: If I'm away from home for a period of time, I will stop mail delivery.

japanese: もしあることが意味を成さなければ、それは多分論理的でないのである。
english: If something doesn't make sense, it probably isn't logical.

japanese: もしあらしでなかったら間に合っていただろうに。
english: If it hadn't been for the storm, we would have been in time.

japanese: もしアメリカ人ならば、日本人とは違った反応をしていただろう。
english: Americans would have responded differently from Japanese.

japanese: もしアメリカで勉強するなら学生ビザを得る必要がある。
english: If you want to study in the United States, you need to get a student visa.

japanese: アメリカで留学したいなら、学生ビザが必要です。
english: If you want to study in the United States, you need to get a student visa.

japanese: もしあの時水がなければ、兵隊は死んでいただろう。
english: Without water, the soldiers would have died.

japanese: もしあの時、彼が私と一緒にいてくれたら、私はあんなことはしなかったのだが。
english: If he had been with me then, I would not have done such a thing.

japanese: もしあの事故に遭わなかったら、彼は今も元気でいるだろうに。
english: If he had not met with that accident, he would be alive now.

japanese: もしあの汽車にまにあっていたならば、今ごろあちらに着いているでしょう。
english: If I had been in time for the train, I would be there now.

japanese: もしあなたの助けがなければ、私は決して成功しないだろう。
english: Were it not for your help, I could never succeed.

japanese: もしあなたの助けがなかったら、私は失敗していただろう。
english: If it had not been for your help, I would have failed.

japanese: もしあなたの助けがなかったら、私は試合に負けていたでしょう。
english: If it had not been for your help, I would have lost the game.

japanese: あなたの助けが無ければそれはできなかったでしょう。
english: But for your help, I could not have done it.

japanese: もしあなたの援助がなければ、私たちは失敗していたかもしれない。
english: If it had not been for your help, we might have failed.

japanese: もしあなたに助けてもらわなかったら、私はきっと失敗してただろう。
english: If it had not been for your help, I would certainly have failed.

japanese: もしあなたなら、その仕事に申し込むだろう。
english: Were I you, I would apply for the job.

japanese: もしあなたが来られなければだれか代理をよこしてください。
english: If you can't come, send someone in your stead.

japanese: もしあなたが来ることができればうれしいのですが。
english: I should be very pleased if you could come.

japanese: もしあなたが話の途中とか社交の場で長い間黙っていると、アメリカ人はあなたに話させようと努力する。
english: If you are silent in a conversation or social situation for a long time, Americans will try to get you to talk.

japanese: あなたが明日釣りに行かないんなら、私も行かないよ。
english: If you do not go fishing tomorrow, I will not either.

japanese: もしあなたが明日釣りに行くなら私も行きます。
english: If you go fishing tomorrow, I will, too.

japanese: もしあなたが彼との手紙の交換ができなくなればあなたが寂しくなるだろう信じていたのです。
english: If you didn't have him to exchange letters with, you would be lonely.

japanese: 成功するつもりなら、君はもっと熱心に勉強しなければならない。
english: If you are to succeed, you must work harder.

japanese: 成功しようと思うなら、もっと一生懸命働かねばならない。
english: If you are to succeed, you must work harder.

japanese: 成功したいのなら、君はもっと一生懸命働くべきだ。
english: If you are to succeed, you must work harder.

japanese: もしあなたが成功するつもりなら、もっと一生懸命に勉強しなければならない。
english: If you are to succeed, you must work harder.

japanese: もしあなたが成功したいなら、もっと働かなければなりません。
english: If you are to succeed, you must work harder.

japanese: 真相を知っていても今は知らないふりをしていた方がいいよ。
english: Even if you know the truth, you had better pretend otherwise at present.

japanese: 真実を知っていても、今はそうでないふりをしていた方がいいですよ。
english: Even if you know the truth, you had better pretend otherwise at present.

japanese: もしあなたが助けてくれなかったら私は失敗したでしょう。
english: If you had not helped me, I would have failed.

japanese: もしあなたが手伝ってくれなかったら、私はクビになっていたでしょう。
english: Had it not been for your help, I would have been fired.

japanese: もしあなたが試験でカンニングをやってもそれで何の咎めも受けずに済むと思っているなら、とんでもない話だ。
english: If you think you can get away with cheating on the exam, you've got another thing coming.

japanese: あなたが支持してくれるなら、やりましょう。
english: I will do it on condition that you support me.

japanese: 私の立場なら、どうしますか。
english: If you were in my place, what would you do?

japanese: もしあなたが私の立場だったらどうおっしゃいますか。
english: What would you say if you were in my place?

japanese: もしあなたがダイエット中なら、朝食を抜くのはよくないということを忘れてはいけない。
english: Don't forget that, if you are on a diet, skipping breakfast will not help you.

japanese: もしあなたがそんなにたくさん食べていなかったら、今それほど眠くはないでしょう。
english: If you had not eaten so much, you would not be so sleepy now.

japanese: もしあした雨が降ったとしてもピクニックに行きますか。
english: Suppose it rains tomorrow, shall we still go on the picnic?

japanese: もしあした雨がやまなければ１週間降りつづくことになる。
english: It will have been raining for a week if it does not stop tomorrow.

japanese: もしあいつにそれができたら、俺の首をやるよ。
english: If he can do that, I will eat my hat.

japanese: もし７時に家を出ていたら、時間どおりに到着できただろう。
english: Had we left home at seven, we could have arrived on time.

japanese: もし６月前にその仕事を完成するつもりならばもっと努力が必要です。
english: If you are to finish the work before June, you will have to work much better.

japanese: もし２、３分お許しいただければ、電話をかけたいのですが。
english: If you will excuse me for a few minutes, I'd like to make a call.

japanese: もし１０歳若ければ、あなたはなにをしますか。
english: What would you do if you were ten years younger?

japanese: もし、私の近くに来るときは是非立ち寄って下さい。
english: If you come my way, drop in on me.

japanese: もし私にもっとお金があったなら、そのペンを買ったであろうに。
english: If I had had more money, I would have bought the pen.

japanese: もっとお金があったらあのペンを買っていたのだけど。
english: If I had had more money, I would have bought the pen.

japanese: 私なら、青く塗るだろうね。
english: If I were you, I would paint it blue.

japanese: 私だったら青く塗りますね。
english: If I were you, I would paint it blue.

japanese: もし気にさわったら、ごめん。
english: I apologize if I hurt your feelings.

japanese: もし、また時計を壊したらママに叱られますよ。
english: If you break the clock again, you'll catch it from Mommy.

japanese: もし、システムの完全な入れ替えが必要ということになれば、彼らは古いシステムで満足することと思う。
english: If it's going to require a total restructuring, I'm sure they will be satisfied with the old system.

japanese: もし、きちんと食べなかったら永久に太ったままですよ、とブラウン夫人はベスに警告しました。
english: Mrs. Brown warned Beth that if she didn't eat properly she would be permanently overweight.

japanese: もし、あなたが税金を払う身であれば、そんなことは言わないはずですよ。
english: If you were footing the bill, you wouldn't say that.

japanese: もうこれ以上パンはありません。
english: We don't have any more bread.

japanese: もうパンがないんですよ。
english: We don't have any more bread.

japanese: もごもご言うのはやめてください。
english: Please don't mumble.

japanese: モールへ行ってきたところです。
english: I've been to the mall.

japanese: あそこの店はあまり好きじゃない。
english: I don't really like the stores there.

japanese: モールに行きましょうか。
english: Should we go to the mall?

japanese: モーテルはホテルと似てるがずっと小さく、自動車で旅する人々に使用される。
english: A motel is like a hotel only much smaller and is used mostly by people traveling by automobile.

japanese: モーテルに関する情報をください。
english: I'd like some information on motels.

japanese: モーツァルトは彼の時代のどの作曲家よりも偉大であった。
english: Mozart was greater than any other composer of his time.

japanese: モーツァルトは、音楽家になるように育てられた。
english: Mozart was brought up to be a musician.

japanese: モーツァルトの音楽はいつも私にとって、喜びを与えてくれるものだ。
english: The music of Mozart is always pleasing to me.

japanese: モーツアルトの一生は大変短かった。
english: Mozart's life was very short.

japanese: モーツアルトのように３歳のときにピアノを習い始めたのですか。
english: Did you start to learn the piano when you were three, like Mozart?

japanese: モーツァルトがこの世を去ってから２００年になる。
english: It has been 200 years since Mozart died.

japanese: モーターは動き出した。
english: The motor started to run.

japanese: モーターについては何も問題がない。
english: There is nothing the matter with the motor.

japanese: モーターがきちんと動かない。
english: The motor does not function properly.

japanese: もう話しにならない。
english: We're not getting anywhere.

japanese: もう例の手紙の返事を書いたかい。
english: Have you answered that letter yet?

japanese: もう両親から独立してもいいころだよ。
english: It's about time you were independent of your parents.

japanese: もう離れてもいいよ、荷物は私が見ていよう。
english: You can leave now. I'll see to our luggage.

japanese: もう夕食を食べてしまったのか。
english: Have you eaten your dinner already?

japanese: もう晩ご飯食べたの？
english: Have you eaten your dinner already?

japanese: もう夕食は食べました。
english: I've already had my supper.

japanese: もう夕食は済みましたか。
english: Have you eaten dinner yet?

japanese: 夕飯はもう食べたの？
english: Have you eaten dinner yet?

japanese: もう薬を一服飲む時間ですよ。
english: It's time you had a dose of your medicine.

japanese: もう夜中を過ぎた。
english: It's midnight already.

japanese: もう夜の十時だ。
english: It's already ten o'clock at night.

japanese: もう夜になっても静かで平和ではありませんでした。
english: Even at nighttime, it was not quiet and peaceful any more.

japanese: もう戻れない。
english: There's no turning back.

japanese: もう満腹です。
english: I'm so full.

japanese: もう本当においとましなければなりません。
english: I really must say good-bye.

japanese: もう本当にさよならを言わないといけません。
english: I really must say good-bye.

japanese: もう本当にさよならしないといけません。
english: I really must say good-bye.

japanese: もう本を読みましたか。
english: Have you read the book yet?

japanese: もう呆れてものも言えないよ。
english: I'm appalled. You leave me speechless.

japanese: もう辺りが暗くなってきた。秋の日は釣瓶落としだね。
english: It's getting dark early around here. The sun seems to drop like a rock when autumn rolls around.

japanese: もう風邪は治りましたか。
english: Have you got over your cold yet?

japanese: もう部屋を掃除しましたか。
english: Have you cleaned your room yet?

japanese: もう自分の部屋の掃除はしたの？
english: Have you cleaned your room yet?

japanese: もう部屋を出てもよろしい。
english: You can leave the room now.

japanese: 彼女に電話しましたか。
english: Have you called her yet?

japanese: もう彼女に電話しましたか。
english: Have you called her yet?

japanese: もう彼女が帰る時間ですよ。
english: It is time for her to go home.

japanese: もう彼は卒業したのだからまじめにならなければだめだ。
english: Now that he has graduated, he must become more serious.

japanese: もう彼の侮辱にはがまんできません。
english: I can not put up with his insults any longer.

japanese: 私はもはや彼を待てない。
english: I can wait for him no longer.

japanese: もう彼のことを待てない。
english: I can wait for him no longer.

japanese: これ以上、彼のことは待てない。
english: I can wait for him no longer.

japanese: もう彼に電話しましたか。
english: Did you call him yet?

japanese: もう彼に会いましたね。
english: Have you met him already?

japanese: もう彼に会いましたか。
english: Have you met him yet?

japanese: もう彼にはうんざりだ。
english: I've had it with him.

japanese: もう彼とは口をきかないぞ。
english: I won't talk with him anymore.

japanese: もう髪を切ってもらってもいい時ですよ。大分伸び過ぎていますよ。
english: It's high time you had your hair cut; it's grown too long.

japanese: もう八時なのであなたはすぐに学校に行かなくてはいけないと思う。
english: Seeing that it is 8 o'clock, I think you should leave for school soon.

japanese: ８時なのであなたはすぐに学校に行かなくてはいけないと思う。
english: Seeing that it is 8 o'clock, I think you should leave for school soon.

japanese: もう八月で夏休みも終わろうとしている。
english: Here it's August and our summer vacation is nearly over.

japanese: もう売り切れてしまったのですが、次回有効券をお渡しいたします。
english: It's out of stock, but I can give you a rain check.

japanese: もう年賀状を全部書いてしまったのですか。
english: Have you written all the New Year's cards already?

japanese: 年賀状はもう全部書き上げましたか？
english: Have you written all the New Year's cards already?

japanese: 年賀状はもう全部書き終わった？
english: Have you written all the New Year's cards already?

japanese: もう年だよ。
english: I feel my age.

japanese: もう二度と町のことは気にしなくなりました。
english: Never again would she be curious about the city.

japanese: 彼女は二度とあの場所には住みたくない。
english: Never again would she want to live there.

japanese: もう二度と酒にふけってはいけません。
english: You should not take to drinking again.

japanese: また酒にふけってはいけない。
english: You should not take to drinking again.

japanese: もう二度と犬を飼わないと決めた。
english: I've decided not to keep a dog again.

japanese: もう二度とそこへ行かない方がいい。
english: You had better not go there again.

japanese: もう二度とこんなに遅れてはいけません。
english: Never be this late again.

japanese: 二度とこんなに遅刻しないこと。
english: Never be this late again.

japanese: 二度とこんな遅くなるんじゃないぞ。
english: Never be this late again.

japanese: もう二、三か月もすると、君は英語が流暢に話せるようになるだろう。
english: You will be able to speak fluent English in another few months.

japanese: もう独り立ちすべき時だよ。
english: It's time you stood on your own two feet.

japanese: もう答えは出ましたか。
english: Have you worked out the answer yet?

japanese: もう電話を切らなくてはなりません。電話が空くのを待っている人がいるのです。
english: I've got to hang up now. Someone is waiting to use the phone.

japanese: もう電子レンジは買い換えてもいい頃です。
english: It is about time we bought a new microwave oven.

japanese: そろそろレンジも買い替え時期ね。
english: It is about time we bought a new microwave oven.

japanese: 彼女は長いことお会いしてません。
english: I haven't seen her for ages.

japanese: 彼女には長いことお会いしていません。
english: I haven't seen her for ages.

japanese: もう長いこと彼女をみかけない。
english: I haven't seen her for ages.

japanese: もう朝から晩まで働いてクタクタだよ。
english: I'm beat. I've been working from dawn to dusk.

japanese: もう昼食を食べましたか。
english: Have you eaten lunch yet?

japanese: お昼ごはんは食べたの？
english: Have you eaten lunch yet?

japanese: お昼はもう食べた？
english: Have you eaten lunch yet?

japanese: 私は昼食を食べた。
english: I have already eaten lunch.

japanese: 私はもう昼食を食べました。
english: I have already eaten lunch.

japanese: 私はもう昼食をとった。
english: I have already eaten lunch.

japanese: もうお昼ご飯は食べました。
english: I have already eaten lunch.

japanese: お昼はもう食べたよ。
english: I have already eaten lunch.

japanese: もう昼食はすみましたか。
english: Have you eaten your lunch yet?

japanese: もう遅くなってきたし、ひとりで帰りたくないわ。
english: It's getting late. I don't wanna go home alone.

japanese: もう遅くなったから、私たちは家に帰らなければならない。
english: Seeing that it is late, we should go home.

japanese: もう遅いわよ。
english: It's late.

japanese: もう遅いので・・・。
english: It's getting late, so we'd better get going.

japanese: 遅くなってきましたので、そろそろお暇いたします。
english: It's getting late, so we'd better get going.

japanese: もう遅いからテレビを消しなさい。
english: As it is late, turn off the TV.

japanese: もう遅いから。
english: We'd better roll now.

japanese: もう暖かくなったので外出できる。
english: Now that the weather is warmer, I can go outdoors.

japanese: もう誰も彼を、信用してない。
english: No one trusts him any more.

japanese: もう大人なのだから、やるべきことは自分の責任で決めなさい。
english: Now that you are grown-up, it is up to you to decide what to do.

japanese: もう大丈夫。大船に乗った気で心配しないで。
english: It's OK now. Don't worry. You can depend on me one hundred percent.

japanese: もう大学生なんだから、君はもっと一生懸命勉強すべきだ。
english: Now that you're a college student, you should study harder.

japanese: もう大学生なのだから、もっと分別があってもよかろう。
english: Now that you are a college student, you should know better.

japanese: もうあんたも大学生なんだから、ちゃんとしなさいよ。
english: Now that you are a college student, you should know better.

japanese: もう大きくなったのだから、行儀良くしなさい。
english: Now you are a big boy, behave yourself.

japanese: 僕はもうこれ以上待てない。
english: I can't wait any more.

japanese: もう待てないよ。
english: I can't wait any more.

japanese: もうこれ以上待てません。
english: I can't wait any more.

japanese: もうこれ以上待てないよ。
english: I can't wait any more.

japanese: 私はもうこれ以上待つ気がしない。
english: I don't feel like waiting any longer.

japanese: もう待つ気が無くなった。
english: I don't feel like waiting any longer.

japanese: もう息子が学校から帰る時間だ。
english: It is time my son came home from school.

japanese: もう戦争はごめんだ。
english: We think that there should be no more wars.

japanese: もう晴れたよ。
english: It's already cleared up.

japanese: もう数時間ずっとこれを読んでいる。
english: I have been reading this for a few hours.

japanese: もう身を固めて落ち着いてもいいころだよ。
english: It's high time you got married and settled down.

japanese: もう神も仏もない。
english: Now there is neither God nor Buddha.

japanese: もう真実を知ったのだから、多分気分がよくなるでしょう。
english: Now that you know the truth, perhaps you'll feel better.

japanese: もう新聞を読み終わりましたか。
english: Have you done with the paper?

japanese: もう新車を買う方がいいよ。
english: You should get yourself a new car now.

japanese: 寝る時間よ。
english: It's time to go to bed.

japanese: 寝る時間ですよ。
english: It's time to go to bed.

japanese: もう寝る時刻ですよ。
english: It's time to go to bed.

japanese: もう寝る時間だぞ。
english: It's time to go to bed.

japanese: もう寝るときだ。
english: It's time to go to bed.

japanese: もう寝なければなりません。
english: It's time to go to bed.

japanese: 寝る時間だよ。
english: It's time to go to bed.

japanese: もう寝る時間です。ラジオを消しなさい。
english: It's time to go to bed. Turn off the radio.

japanese: 寝る時間よ。ラジオを消しなさい。
english: It's time to go to bed. Turn off the radio.

japanese: そろそろ寝る時間だぞ。
english: It's time you went to bed.

japanese: そろそろ床についてもいいころだ。
english: It's time you went to bed.

japanese: もう寝ます。
english: I will hit the sack.

japanese: もう寝なくてはいけない時間でしょ。
english: It's high time you were in bed.

japanese: もう食べ終わったのだから出かけよう。
english: Now that we have eaten, let's go.

japanese: もう食べ始めてもいいですか。
english: May I start eating now?

japanese: もう食べてもいいですか？
english: May I start eating now?

japanese: もう食べれないよ。
english: I could not eat another bite.

japanese: もうこれ以上食べられないよ。
english: I can't eat any more.

japanese: もうこれ以上は食べられない。
english: I can't eat any more.
